business.headline: Sensex ends over 550 points lower, Nifty dips as IT stocks slideThe S&P BSE Sensex dropped by 553.12 points to close at 79,389.06, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 135.50 points, settling at 24,205.35. Broader market indices also declined as volatility weighed on investor sentiment across Dalal Street.

Explained: Why Cipla share price surged up to 10% todayCipla share price: The stock rose by 9.88% to reach a day high of Rs 1,557.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).  At 10:41 am, shares of Cipla were up 8.24% at Rs 1,534.25.

HDFC Bank's HDB Financial files Rs 12,500 crore IPO. Check detailsHDFC Bank, holding a 94.6% stake in HDB Financial, will sell shares worth up to Rs 10,000 crore, while HDB Financial plans to issue fresh shares totalling Rs 2,500 crore, as outlined in the filing.
Diwali fireworks missing from Dalal Street as Sensex, Nifty fall The S&P BSE Sensex was down 199.13 points to 79,743.05 at 10:07 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 126 points to 24,340.85.

Paytm lights up Noida skies with dazzling Diwali drone showPaytm celebrated Diwali with a dazzling drone show at its Noida headquarters, featuring messages like "Happy Diwali" and "Paytm karo" in the night sky.

Sensex, Nifty snap 2-day rally as dull Q2 earnings disrupt momentum The BSE Sensex fell 0.5% to close at 79,966, while the NSE Nifty 50 index declined by the same margin to 24,350, as market sentiment weakened due to ongoing foreign selling and lacklustre corporate earnings.
StoxBox's Diwali picks: 5 stocks to light up your portfolioGet ready to brighten your portfolio this Diwali with these five promising stocks that are expected to deliver strong future performance.

Falling behind in AI race has cost Samsung $122 billion: Report Samsung has lost $122 billion in market value since July, a tumble of 32% that makes it the largest decline among global chipmakers this year.
Elcid's 66,92,535% surge makes it India's most expensive stock, surpassing MRFElcid Investments, based in Mumbai, is a non-banking financial company (NBFC) with a strong connection to Asian Paints.

Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports: Why Adani stocks are gaining todayAdani Enterprises shares rose 4.42% to Rs 2,974.50 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) at 11:41 am, while APSEZ saw a 2.62% lift to Rs 1,408.65. All other Adani Group companies also traded in the green, supported by these positive cues.

RBI's 102-tonne gold haul this Dhanteras: What's behind the move?The RBI recently relocated 102 tonnes of gold from the Bank of England's vaults to secure facilities within India as it now hold a total of 855 tonnes in reserves.

Explained: Why Maruti Suzuki share price gained over 2% despite weak Q2 resultsMaruti Suzuki's quarterly report revealed a 17% year-on-year decline in net profit to Rs 3,103 crore, falling short of market expectations.

Sensex, Nifty in red as Q2 earnings dampen Diwali spirit; Adani stocks gainThe NSE Nifty 50 dropped 0.24% to 24,411.9 points, while the BSE Sensex declined 0.28% to 80,142.11 by 9:57 am. Seven out of the 13 major sectors showed losses, while small-cap and mid-cap indices performed better, rising 1% and 0.5%, respectively.

Afcons Infrastructure IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Afcons Infrastructure allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Afcons Infrastructure Day 3: Check latest subscription, GMP sees dip  The Afcons Infrastructure IPO comprises a fresh issue of 2.7 crore shares valued at Rs 1,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 9.03 crore shares worth Rs 4,180 crore.

Muhurat trading 2024: Expert tips to maximise your Diwali returnsMuhurat trading is a unique session conducted by Indian stock exchanges on Diwali, rooted in the belief that this 'auspicious hour' is a time to attract prosperity.

Adani Enterprises Q2 results: Profit surges 664% YoY to Rs 1,742 croreThe company reported a net profit of Rs 1,742 crore in the July-September quarter, up from Rs 228 crore in the same period last year.

Sensex, Nifty pare losses to end higher as banking stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 363.99 points to 80,369.03 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 127.70 points to settle at 24,446.85. Most of the broader market indices, including smallcap and midcaps, staged a stronger recovery.

Buying property this festive season: 3 things you should consider Many people consider Dhanteras an auspicious time to make significant investments, with property being one of the most popular choices.
Maruti Suzuki share price slumps over 5% as Q2 profit declines 17%Following a disappointing Q2 performance, shares of Maruti Suzuki fell over 5.5% amid concerns about the company's future growth.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Trump flags attacks on Hindus in Bangladesh, vows to boost ties with IndiaFormer US President Donald Trump condemned the attacks on Hindus in Bangladesh and said he was keen to strengthen ties with India and Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Delhi firecracker ban goes up in smoke on Diwali, air quality 'very poor'Relentless burning of firecrackers by people on Diwali led to the worsening of air quality levels, with the AQI reaching close to 'severe' category at many places in Delhi.

From MS Dhoni to Rohit Sharma: Full IPL Retention List revealedThe full IPL retention list is in as the 10 teams have retained 46 players ahead of the 2025 auction. Rohit Sharma and MS Dhoni lead the list of the superstars who have been retained by their franchises on October 31, Thursday.

Raj Thackeray's son gets BJP support in Mahim seat, Shinde Sena in jiffyThe Mahim constituency faces a three-way showdown as the BJP supports MNS's Amit Thackeray while its ally Shiv Sena insists on fielding sitting MLA Sadanand Sarvankar, with both parties firm in their stance.

Crisis at food banks is reality check of the Canadian dreamFood banks in Canada, which provide food for free, have been pushed to the brink as a record number of people are leaning on them for survival. Around 30% of those tapping the food banks are newcomers to Canada and are likely to include Indians. This is how the rush at food banks is a reality check of the Canadian dream.

Rajasthan recalls textbooks on Godhra incident, issue won't be taught in schoolsGovernment-run schools in Rajasthan will no longer teach about the 2002 Godhra train burning incident as the state government recalled some textbooks, contending that they contain controversial references to the issue.

From Rishabh Pant to KL Rahul: Top 10 talking points from IPL RetentionsThe Indian Premier League retentions were announced on Thursday, October 31. There were several talking points starting from the snubbing of KL Rahul and Shreyas Iyer as captains and Rishabh Pant voluntarily entering the auction pool ending his 9-year stay at Delhi Capitals.

Man, nephew shot dead while celebrating Diwali at Delhi home, son injuredDiwali celebrations turned tragic for a family when two armed men shot dead a 40-year-old man and his 16-year-old nephew at their home, while his 10-year-son was injured in Delhi.

IPL Retention: How much purse does each team have ahead of mega-auction?The Indian Premier League franchises announced their retention lists on Thursday, October 31. With the new retention rules in place, here's a look at how much purse money with left with each franchise.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Patrolling resumes at Depsang, Demchok as disengagement along LAC completeThe Indian and Chinese armies resumed patrolling in eastern Ladakh's Demchok and Depsang Plains after completing disengagement, following an agreement to end the four-year standoff along the India-China border.

Man carrying hand-made firecrackers on scooter dies in explosionThe explosion occurred when a sack of 'onion bombs', being transported on a Honda Activa scooter, detonated after the vehicle hit a pothole, causing the firecrackers to shift and trigger a blast.

Amaran review: Emotional tribute to army menReleased-Thu Oct 31, 2024Amaran movie review: Directed by Rajkumar Periasamy, Amaran is a biopic of Major Mukund Varadarajan, starring Sivakarthikeyan and Sai Pallavi. The film is a fitting tribute to the valour and sacrifice of Major Mukund.

'Dual character': Lt Governor vs J&K government over Foundation Day boycottJammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha criticised the Omar Abdullah-led government for boycotting the Union Territory's Foundation Day, calling it a display of their "dual character".

Bhulai Bhai, BJP's oldest party worker, dies at 111Bhulai Bhai, who came into the limelight when Prime Minister Narendra Modi enquired about his health during the Covid-19 pandemic, has died at the age of 111.

Harris woos Latino voters in Arizona, Trump condemns attacks on Hindus in BangladeshUS Presidential Election 2024 Live Updates: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris, along with their running mates JD Vance and Tim Walz, are on the final leg of their campaigns with just days left until the US Presidential election. Both the Republican and Democratic camps are confident of winning the Oval Office, with polls predicting a close race. Early voting has already started, showing a steady turnout in many states. Voter turnout is expected to be high, reflecting the intense interest and stakes involved. Key issues dominating the campaign include the economy, immigration, healthcare, abortion rights, foreign policy, and several other topics. The election is closely watched worldwide, as the outcome will have significant implications for global policies. Stay tuned with India Today for the latest updates in the lead-up to the November 5 US Presidential election.

Industrial alcohol: How Supreme Court made it 'happy hours' for statesThe 8:1 ruling will enable states to curb misuse of industrial alcohol and boost their revenue even as the dissenting judge has flagged regulatory and economic concerns

India's silent epidemic: What's killing our students? Surging suicides in campuses, driven by relentless academic pressure and inadequate mental health support, expose the deep-rooted flaws in the educational and societal frameworks

Union Minister Jitender Singh's brother dies at 59, last rites likely todayUnion Minister Jitender Singh's younger brother Devender Singh Rana died at the age of 59 in Faridabad due to prolonged illness. He was a BJP MLA from Nagrota in Jammu region and his last rites may be held on Friday.

LSG owner cryptic remark after snubbing KL Rahul: Wanted winning mentalityLucknow Super Giants owner Sanjeev Goenka made a cryptic remark about winning mindset and personal milestones after not retaining KL Rahul ahead of IPL 2025 auction.

Brother review: Jayam Ravi's family drama could have been a TV serialReleased-Thu Oct 31, 2024Brother movie review: Director M Rajesh's Brother, starring Jayam Ravi, Priyanka Mohan and Bhumika Chawla, is an outdated film. The film is a two-hour-long snoozefest.

Meet Karthik, Indian-American businessman running for Mayor in TexasIf elected, Karthik Naralasetty would be the youngest mayor in The Hills' history and the first of Indian descent, marking a historic milestone for both The Hills and Texas.

Kohli reveals RCB's 'goal to win at least one IPL title' after being retainedVirat Kohli expressed his gratitude after being retained by RCB ahead of the IPL 2025 mega auction. He said that the goal of the franchise would be to win at least one IPL title in the three-year cycle.

Multi-stage NEET UG exams, digital paper delivery among suggested reformsA government panel has proposed multi-stage NEET UG exams, digital question papers, and OMR responses to tackle exam security risks following the recent paper leak incident.

Bloody Beggar review: Kavin's dark comedy fails to explore its full potentialReleased-Thu Oct 31, 2024Bloody Beggar movie review: Director Sivabalan Muthukumar's Bloody Beggar, starring Kavin and Redin Kingsley, is a dark comedy that also doubles up as a commentary about the rich-poor divide.

Actors Park Hyung-sik, Ma Dong-seok, Seo In-guk unite for upcoming K-drama TwelveK-drama actors Park Hyung-sik, Ma Dong-seok, and Seo In-guk have teamed up for Twelve, a fantasy series delving into Eastern zodiac mythology.

Bagheera review: Srii Murali's grit elevates a bold yet imperfect filmReleased-Thu Oct 31, 2024Bagheera Movie Review: This Prashanth Neel story has been directed by Dr Suri and stars Srii Murali of Ugramm fame in the lead role. In this vigilante action drama, there are brilliant concepts and ideas, but the execution needed more work to make it feel "super."

Ram Charan, Kiara Advani's Game Changer teaser to release on November 9The teaser for Game Changer, featuring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, will be released on November 9, as announced on Diwali. Directed by Shankar, the film is set to premiere on January 10, 2025.

sports.headline: Should Kohli be made RCB captain in IPL? Manjrekar strongly against it  IPL 2025: Sanjay Manjrekar said that Virat Kohli hasn't put in impressive enough performances to be made the captain of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the upcoming edition.

KL Rahul leaves LSG, Nicholas Pooran expected to captain franchiseLucknow Super Giants captain KL Rahul has been released by the franchise. Rahul, who was at LSG for the last 3 seasons is expected to be courted by several teams in the IPL auction.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
